At the top of the page there used to be a place where you could do a search for things in your emails by typing in key words.

That search location is no longer on the email site.

content: Sometimes, messages appear corrupt because the index is flawed. You can check that by highlighting folder, rightclick, select properties and then click repair. That may fix it.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks for the reply. It wasn't a fix, but it did give me an idea. Turns out it isn't a Thunderbird problem at all, since when I look at the same message on the mail provider's site, it has the same content. So it must be something happening further upstream. But where and why? A mystery...
creator: jamesqf

content: I suggest pressing the shift key when you click 'reply' to switch you to plain text for this one message. I think that may eliminate the color issue.

content: this may work: - highlight folder - click edit>select>all - right click in message list and select 'forward and redirect>as attachments' - send

content: Dato che sei in IMAP e dato che escludi che il problema possa partire da altri dispositivi collegati alla stessa mail, a mio avviso è più sbrigativo se cancelli l'account da Thunderbird e lo ri-configuri da zero. Ovviamente facendo prima un backup -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo

content: Buona domanda... ma dovresti chiederlo a Google perché ci metta un giorno a mandarti un codice. Che c'entra Thunderbird?
creator: @next

content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
creator: @next

content: 128.5.0esr (64 bit) Windows 11 Pro 24H2 Gmail IMAP Estensioni: File link provider for dropbox, ImportExportTools NG, Remove Duplicate Messages Nessun errore visualizzato Sicurezza di Windows

content: Panic over. I had changed the data to display and managed to turn off the date so that when I went to 'sort by' date was not an option. I had not appreciated that not being in bold type indicated that it was not an option. John
creator: JohnRieley

content:
Se in passato hai creato una password principale, allora devi inserire quella -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/password-principale-thunderbird

Se non hai mai usato la password principale, allora devi inserire la password di accesso a Windows (per Windows 10/11). Te ne accorgi perché la richiesta avviene con lo stile del sistema operativo.
creator: @next

content: There is no 'thunderbird server.' Thunderbird on your PC keeps the last password that was accepted. If you installed a fresh copy of Thunderbird on a different PC, there is no password stored. So, if you are receiving prompts for the password, the request is coming from your email host. That may indicate the password is wrong, or the configuration is wrong.
creator: davidsk

content: That message does not come from Thunderbird. Please provide more detailed information for a possible response. Thanks.

content:
Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: There should be a 'Save' button in lower right of the customize menu.
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you for the kind words. I was glad to assist. :)
creator: davidsk

content: - click 'account settings' - highlight the account to delete - slightly below the account listings on same pane is 'Account Actions'. click that and then the 'remove account' option
creator: davidsk
